serves the church family and surrounding community by offering a quality child development program for children ages two through four. Our outstanding program features…
Half-day program hours from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m., five days per week
Safe, bright and attractive classrooms and playground areas
The Mt. Horeb learning environment is rich, varied, warm, stimulating and safe

for a young child’s healthy development. Teachers use The Creative Curriculum for Preschoolers, a developmentally appropriate, whole language, thematic approach to preschool education. Each classroom is arranged by interest areas, creatively organized to foster growth, imagination, creativity and independence. Activities are planned through centers which include language, math, science and art activities. 4K students will be introduced to our new curriculum called “Get Set for School,” part of the Handwriting Without Tears program.

Once a week, children enjoy a 30-minute music class, and our pastors leads chapel time every Wednesday morning. Other special activities include a Preschool Art Show, Holiday Music Program, Preschool Sunday at the church.

Two-year-olds attend either Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday. Three-year-olds have the option of attending three days (M/T/W) or four days (M-Th). Four-year-olds have the option of attending four days (M-Th) or five days (M-F).

Regular preschool hours are Monday-Thursday from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m., but those enrolled in the Early Bird program may arrive in the morning at 8 a.m. Three- and four-year-olds may bring a lunch and join the Lunch Bunch, staying at the preschool until 2 p.m.
Mt. Horeb Lutheran Church in Chapin, SC, is seeking a dedicated
to support the church's daily operations, ensuring a welcoming and efficient office environment.
Resumes will be accepted until the position is filled.

The Administrative Assistant provides comprehensive office support to the pastor, staff, and congregation. Responsibilities include preparing bulletins and newsletters, managing communications, coordinating supplies and events, and maintaining records.
For a full description of this position, please see the full details
Submit your resume and three references to
. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled. Visit
: Pastor, as supported by the Human Resources Committee

PERSONNEL POLICIES STATEMENT: The employees of this church, in all their services –
both within the congregation and in the fulfillment of the church’s mission in the world – shall
carry out the duties to which they are assigned in the faithfulness to the faith and mission of the
Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.
Please submit your resume and contact information for 3 references to
.  Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

The Administrative Assistant provides office services for members of the parish staff and
various other committees and functions of the church. Provide Guidance and Direction to
other office staff as needed in all administrative duties.

The Administrative Assistant shall provide support to all other staff members. This
support shall include but is not limited to the following specific responsibilities:

Function as staff assistant to Pastor and other designated staff in planning,
coordinating, and implementing administrative services, projects, and events.
Create bulletin and announcement sheet weekly in Publisher software.
Create Newsletter monthly in Publisher software.

Research Sundays & Seasons weekly for: readings, preface, prayers, graphics,
etc. to be used each week including hymns and correct verbiage as it pertains
to the Season and/or Sunday for the bulletin and the children’s
pages/bulletin.
Negotiate the lease on the copier/printer with vendors prior to renewal date.

Record copier totals for black/white and color copies each month for vendor
reporting.

Contact maintenance/service providers when needed, i.e. plumber, Terminix
and others.
Gather and research information to develop the Annual Church Directory.
Order Lilies annually for Easter Sunday.
Order Advent and Lenten Devotionals annually.
Order office supplies including janitorial, kitchen supplies as required.

Create and mail All Saints Postcards for the families of deceased members
each year.
Create other postcards, brochures, ‘flyers’, signs as needed.
Meet weekly with Pastor to review ‘needs’ for upcoming week.

Gather data/information and complete the congregational report annually to
the SC Synod.
Order Sunday School material as requested.
Order candles and any other worship items as requested.
Update Shepherd’s Staff as needed (new members, deceased, transfers)
Run reports from Shepherd’s Staff as required.
Create and post the eNews weekly for Friday morning publishing.

Send mass congregational emails/communications when requested and
appropriate, i.e. obituaries of members.
Send email each week to the Lector assigned Sunday service.

Order Altar Flowers for members each Sunday and maintain an accounting
record.
Complete the U.S. Post Office Form that is included in bulk mailings.

When Altar flowers are donated, make arrangements for shut-ins receipt, if
flowers available for distribution.
Manage sound board during Lenten 11am worship service.
Create and maintain monthly calendar of events/meetings/Services.
Maintain the birthday/marriage anniversary dates list of members.

Order background checks in advance for anyone to be in contact with children
in our church (Sunday school teachers, youth leaders, etc.)
Maintain the shut-in list and labels.
Generate Transfer letters when members join or depart Mt. Horeb Lutheran Church.
Register members for SC Synod Assembly. Book hotels as requested.
Perform other duties as assigned by Pastor and/or Council Vice-Chair.

Be a person of faith and embrace the mission of Mt. Horeb Lutheran-Chapin, SC
to Experience and Share God’s Presence.
Maintain high level of service and professionalism for all Admin. Assistant tasks.
Ability to maintain confidentiality in all matters.

PC skills including various word processing programs, spreadsheet software and
desktop publishing.
Knowledge of standard office practices and techniques.
Excellent communications kills, both oral and written.
Three or more years of administrative experience.
Ability to work with diverse personalities.
Technical or business school training preferred.

Normal office environment with minimal exposure to noise and external weather
conditions.
Must be able to lift 25 pounds.
Must be able to work a minimum of 28 hours per week.

job standards required. Other job functions, duties, skills and standards may be added.

.  Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

to support communication and outreach efforts within the church and the community.

is promoted effectively. This role requires strong organizational skills, social media and website proficiency, and the ability to communicate creatively with diverse audiences.

PERSONNEL POLICIES STATEMENT:  The employees of this church, in all their services – both within the congregation and in the fulfillment of the church’s mission in the world – shall carry out the duties to which they are assigned in the faithfulness to the faith and mission of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.
Please submit your resume and contact information for 3 references by
The Outreach Coordinator facilitates communications between the members of the congregation, its Core ministries, and the community at large.

The Outreach Coordinator shall manage and support the communication by and between members of the congregation, the Chapin Community, and the community at-large. These duties shall include but are not limited to the following specific responsibilities:
Be a person of faith and embrace the mission of Mt Horeb Lutheran Church – Chapin, SC to
Greet all people who come into the church office and assist as appropriate.

Manage and maintain the Church’s social media presence, ensuring that timely and appropriate posts are made on a regular basis that highlight the activities and ministries of the congregation. (Facebook, Instagram, X, etc.)
Create and maintain the church website content. Create and update site content. Train volunteers to create and post content from their ministry teams..
Promote the activities of the church through photography, videography, blog posts, articles, etc.
Act as staff liaison to AV/Technology Team to ensure weekly AV needs are met including the training of new AV Team members.
Publish weekly emails to congregation and other times as requested by Pastor and/or Church teams.
Engage with the Chapin community to promote the congregation through advertising, participation in community events, etc.
Look for creative opportunities to promote Mt. Horeb in Chapin and  surrounding area.
Responsible for all mass mailings (copying, stamping, labeling, folding, inserting into envelopes)
Maintain a record of Sunday Service attendance and Visitors. Provide visitor information to the Pastor(s) and Witness Team contact. Update membership register as required.
Print certificates for Baptism, First Communion, Confirmation, Lutheran Men, WELCA, or any church organizations/committees, as needed.
Assist and act as a back-up for the Administrative Assistant as necessary to ensure that the office maintains a high level of service and professionalism.
Ability to communicate effectively: orally and written.
Computer software skills including Windows competency, Social Media acumen, website experience
General knowledge of office equipment operations.
A minimum of one year of experience in an office environment.
Ability to work with diverse personalities.
Ability to maintain confidentiality in all matters.
Normal office environment with minimal exposure to noise and external weather conditions.
Must be able to lift 25 pounds.

NOTE:  This description is not an exhaustive list of all job functions, duties, skills and job standards required.  Other job functions, duties, skills and standards may be added.  Management reserves the right to add or change the job requirements at any time.

This group is open to men of all ages, and offers a chance to gather together around food, fellowship and faith. This group meets at the church on the first Monday of each month

Our Women of the ELCA gather throughout the year to participate in fellowship and devotions as well as service projects. Sisters in Christ create community in Circles, where small groups of women join together to grow in love God and for one another.
Practice Stewardship of by Giving Your Tithes and Offerings

We are invited to participate in the ministry of the church by offering our worship, our time and talents, as well as our monetary contributions. Your tithe (or regular giving) helps support things like education and youth ministry, care for our students and missionaries, support of faith-based and charitable institutions, sustaining pastoral care and upkeep of the church building and physical resources. Offerings are gifts above and beyond regular giving that go to help special projects and needs that may arise. Please prayerfully consider how giving to the church can shape your walk of faith and make a difference in the lives of others. You may make your offerings in person or

Whether you are a woodworker or a choir member, gifted with numbers or great at organizing, whether you have a variety of skills and interests or just have some extra time to give, your time and talents are valuable to the support of God’s church in this place. Please contact us here to volunteer. With a church this size, many hands are needed to keep the property in top working order. If you have interest in helping with property needs, from repairs to technology to clean-up, we’d love to put your skills to good use!
Serve the Needs of the Community

Mt. Horeb is involved in community support ministries in a variety of ways, extending care to those in times of need in our own congregation, in our community and abroad. Ways that we serve those within our faith family include visiting and sending cards and seasonal bags to the elderly, homebound and those experiencing significant life passages, providing meals for the bereaved, and providing vaccinations, health screenings and education for our community members. In addition to congregational support, we serve those in need in our community in a variety of ways. If you would like to help out with our ministries to the local Food Bank, housing repair projects, or helping with ministry to the elderly and homebound in the community, please

The community of Mt. Horeb loves to gather around fun, fellowship and food! We gather weekly for coffee hour at 9:30am, and then at other times throughout the year for special times of learning, worship, or just some good clean fun! Periodically, we organize round-robin supper clubs to facilitate relationship building. For more information on upcoming fellowship events, please check our calendar.

There are a variety of Small Groups that meet at various times and places within Mt. Horeb. In addition to these informal groups, we also have a vibrant Men’s Ministries, Women’s Ministries, Youth and Young Adult Groups. Keep Reading for more information!

As a community of believers, we enter into covenant with God and with one another to serve side-by-side as the Body of Christ. That means giving back from the time, talent and treasures first given to us, and it means building Christ-centered relationships. When the church talks about Support, we’re talking about support of our church and support of one another. At Mt. Horeb, we offer this support in a variety of ways. Here’s a look at how we do Support:

This congregation has a robust Mission Fund which is used to send aid abroad as well as to mobilize missionaries for God’s work with our hands. We support missionaries in Japan, send our own members to places like Guyana and Costa Rica for hands-on mission work, provide mosquito nets for malaria, and participate in local and regional mission trips. We also host ongoing projects like Fair Trade products and cartridge recycling for World Hunger. To help support these ministries, check the calendar for fundraising events, or make a donation to Mt. Horeb’s Global Mission Fund.

We seek to prayerfully and actively respond to needs that arise in places near and far. Our Global Missions team organizes and sends groups to participate in international and nationwide mission trips. Past trips have included building a church in Guyana, disaster response in Alabama, and Habitat International in Costa Rica. Our youth group also participates in mission trips and in service projects involved in the National Youth Gathering.
Serve the Needs of the Community
Mt. Horeb is involved in community support ministries in a variety of ways, extending care to those in times of need in our own congregation, in our community and abroad.

Ways that we serve those within our faith family include visiting and sending cards and seasonal Sunshine bags to the elderly, those unable to attend church and those experiencing significant life passages, and providing meals for the bereaved.

In addition to congregational support, we serve those in need in our community in a variety of ways. If you would like to help out with our ministries to the local food bank, housing repair projects, or helping with ministry to the elderly and homebound in the community, please

Mt. Horeb has a long legacy of serving others in our community and in our world. We believe that we are all called to share what has first been given to us with others, especially those in need. We uphold the dignity of all people and all of God’s creation, and we week to live out that belief in acts of service to others. If you are a believer, ask God how he can use you to spread the love of Christ through acts of compassion. Below are some of the ways we at Mt. Horeb seek to serve others.

The Mission Statement of Mt. Horeb is “Experiencing and Sharing Christ’s Presence.” That means that when we experience the presence of the Risen Christ through worship, prayer, and faithful relationships, we cannot keep that experience to ourselves; we are called to share it with others. Witnessing to the good news and deeds of God is our joyful response to what God has done and is doing. In his letter to the Romans, the Apostle Paul calls us to witness when he reminds us that the saving power of God’s Word works through our evangelism:

“Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved.” But how are they to call on one in whom they have not believed? And how are they to believe in one of whom they have never heard? And how are they to hear without someone to proclaim him? And how are they to proclaim him unless they are sent? As it is written, “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!” – Romans 10:13-15

Being a witness to God through Christ is an everyday act that happens in and through the daily lives of believers. There are also ways that we can witness together as the Body of Christ in this place. Mt. Horeb seeks to be a witness to the community in a variety of ways throughout its ministries.
To learn more about how you can be a witness to the love of God in our community, or to get involved in spreading the word about the ministries of Mt. Horeb, please

title: How to Get Involved With Learn

content.value: There is a place for you in the learning ministries of Mt. Horeb! Whether it’s your first time attending a Bible Study, or you have gifts for planning and teaching, your gifts are an asset to God’s mission in this place. Check out the following ways you can get involved in Faith Formation at Mt. Horeb. If there’s something you’d like to get started that you don’t see on this list, talk to a member of the program staff.
Attend a Sunday Morning Faith Formation Class

There are classes for all ages on Sunday Mornings at 9:00 AM at Mt. Horeb. From nursery to Confirmation Classes to older adult classes, believers and inquirers alike all have a place in one of our studies. For more information on Sunday School classes, please contact the church.
Participate in one of Mt. Horeb’s Youth Groups

Growing in Faith is not always about classroom learning, but also involves exploring faith with peers and building Christ-centered relationships. Mt. Horeb currently has two youth groups: Peace Frogs for grades 3-5 and LCY for grades 6-12. Peace Frogs meet at 4pm on particular Sundays month and LCY meets Sundays at 5pm in the Fellowship Hall.
Bible Studies are offered periodically throughout the year. Topics range from Books of the Bible to studies of Faith and Culture. Check the church news for upcoming Bible Studies, or

At Mt. Horeb, Vacation Bible School is one of the highlights of our learning ministries. Children, youth and adults all come together for one week of great fun, learning about the Word of God. Past themes have included “Kingdom Rock,” “Weird Animals” and “Surf Shack.”

The Confirmation program at Mt. Horeb is designed for 6-8th grade students, to ground them in the foundations of the Christian faith in the Lutheran tradition, and to help shape their lives according to their faith principles and practices. Confirmation classes meet every Sunday morning at 9:00am.

Children at Mt. Horeb meet together for special instruction to prepare them for their first communion. Adults who have not communed may also schedule time with the pastor to be informed about the meaning and faith tenets of Holy Communion.
Teach a Class or Lead a Small Group

If you have discerned a gift for leading or teaching, your gifts are valuable to the ministry of this congregation. Opportunities include: teaching (or assisting) with Sunday School for children, youth or adults, teaching a section on a certain topic, starting a Bible Study or home-based Small Group, or heading up a class at Vacation Bible School. If you would like to serve as a teacher or small group leader, please contact the church office.
Volunteer with Learning Ministries at Mt. Horeb

Under our Core Value LEARN, many things happen throughout the year here. From curriculum planning to the annual Easter Egg Hunt, from the Children’s Christmas Program to the Advent Breakfast & Bible Study, there are many hands at work behind the scenes. If you would like to give of your time to help,

Jesus’ disciples called him “Rabbi,” for he was their teacher. As a community of disciples, our calling is to continue to grow in our learning about God’s Word and its teaching. Through study and the active participation in Faith Formation, we seek to write God’s Word on our hearts (Jeremiah 31:33). We believe that the study of God’s word is a serious endeavor, but it can also be fun! Educational opportunities for children, youth and adults seek to integrate learning and relationship-building for all ages.

The way of a disciple is a lifelong path of learning. The Holy Scriptures (The Bible) and the Holy Spirit are two essential companions along that path. At Mt. Horeb, all disciples are encouraged to read, study and pray with the Word of God. There are many good companions to the Bible that help open up the meaning and background of the text. If you’d like to do more study, check out
Participate in Mt. Horeb’s Music Ministries

Whether you want to sing in one of the weekly worship choirs, supply musical accompaniment or percussion, play in the Alleluia Praise Band, or audition for one of the special choral groups, there is a place for you in our Music Ministries.

Lutheran worship is not an act of the pastors, but it is a conversation among clergy, congregation and the Triune God. We worship according to liturgy handed down from the time of the early church, and the word “liturgy” translates to mean “the work of the people.” That means that everyone is involved in the act of worship.
There is a place for you in the worship life of our church! Here are some opportunities to use your spiritual gifts for the good of the community:
Serve on the Worship and Music Team
Our worship and music team gathers monthly to plan and facilitate the worship life of the congregation by giving input on music, special services, and worship themes.
Volunteer to Set up for Special Worship Services
Have you ever wondered who puts out the poinsettias at Christmas or the white flowers at Easter? Many hands and feet are needed to set up for these special times in the life of our church.

was established in 1891 – about the time the Town of Chapin was organized. The history of Mt. Horeb Church in many ways parallels that of the town itself. A number of leaders in the town have also been leaders in the church. As the town and the surrounding area has grown, so has the congregation of Mt. Horeb.

The congregation can thank the Rev. W. L. Darr for being shepherding pastor who gathered together the little flock from which Mt. Horeb’s congregation has sprung. The report of the President of the Tennessee Synod to its 1889 convention stated that in the Spring of that year “the pastorate in South Carolina left vacant by the death of Dr. Smeltzer (Bethlehem, St. Thomas, and St. Jacobs) extended a call to Candidate W. L. Darr.”

Brother Darr accepted the call and entered his labors on this field in June 1889. Although he served all three congregations, soon after his arrival in the area he gathered together a fourth which was to become Mt. Horeb. This little congregation first met in Mr. George Lindler’s Funeral Home.

Through the years, the congregation has worshiped in three other buildings since then, including the current sanctuary, which was dedicated in October 1963. In the summer of 1999, the church completed an extensive renovation and addition project to its education building, and the interior of the sanctuary was remodeled in 2013.
The online contact form is temporarily offline but will be back soon!  In the meantime, please contact the church office at (803) 345-2000!

Middle & High School students are invited to participate in Lutheran Church Youth (LCY) at Mt. Horeb. LCY meets each week at 5:45pm for faith formational, service-oriented and relationship-building activities
information about Lutheran Church Youth, please

Confirmation is our program for Middle School students to engage the faith through encounter with the Catechetical teachings of the church. In Confirmation, students will learn the basic tenets of the faith, and then together explore what impact their faith has on their day-to-day life, their relationships and their futures. For more information, please

Christian Education is an important emphasis for disciples of all ages, but especially critical in the early years of faith development. Mt. Horeb provides opportunities for children of all ages and adults to engage in Faith Formation each Sunday morning. Children under two are welcome in the nursery during the Sunday School time.

Mt. Horeb always puts on a wonderful VBS for kids from the church and from the community each summer. Past themes have included “Baobab Blast,” “Kingdom Rock” and “Weird Animals.” We hope you will bring a child you love to VBS this year! For more information, please
Volunteer to Set up for Special Worship Services
Have you ever wondered who puts out the poinsettias at Christmas or the white flowers at Easter? Many hands and feet are needed to set up for these special times in the life of our church.
Members of the Altar Guild are the behind-the-scenes facilitators of our worship life. They set the table for communion, change the paraments, and help prepare the worship space for Sunday.
Worship with us on Sunday Mornings and Other Services
We mean it when we say, “All are welcome” in worship each week at Mt. Horeb!
Come join us for worship at 10:00 AM each Sunday!

(Note: Times listed here are the typical times for each service, but these may be adjusted each year to the needs of the church. Be sure to check out the news section and our social media for any changes to these services!)
Wednesdays in Lent at 7 PM, preceded by supper at 6 PM
with Communion at 11 AM and 7 PM
at 10:00 AM, preceded by breakfast at 8:30 AM and then flowering of the cross
to find out how your gifts can fit into the worship ministries.
A community of disciples, actively living out faith in God through Jesus Christ.
An open and welcoming community which seeks to show God’s Grace to all.
A Congregation of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA). Please visit
to learn more. We share in the vision of the ELCA, confessing that Christians are:
by God’s grace for the sake of the world, we are a new creation through God’s living word by the power of the Holy Spirit;
by God’s grace for the sake of the world, we will live among God’s faithful people, hear God’s word and share Christ’s supper;

by God’s grace for the sake of the world, we will proclaim the good news of God in Christ through word and deed, serve all people following the example of our Lord Jesus, and strive for justice and peace in all the world.
Mt. Horeb Lutheran Church is a community of faith located in Chapin, SC and is a part of the Evangelical Lutheran Church of America (ELCA).
We are a vibrant congregation steeped in a rich history while also looking forward towards a promising future!
Come worship with us on Sunday mornings at 10am!
The following is a list of the pastors who have served Mt. Horeb Lutheran Church since its origins in 1889:
Peggy Miller is our Preschool Director.

Peggy has been a member of Mt. Horeb Lutheran Church since 1994 and has been a Sunday School teacher at the church for more than 20 years. For nine years before becoming Preschool Director, Peggy taught the three-year-old preschool class at Mt. Horeb.

Worship is the center of who we are. We believe that worship is the starting point for all that we do, and that in worship, we lay the groundwork for living a life of praise each and every day. At Mt. Horeb, we value a worship experience that both grounds the community in God’s Word as well as uplifts through an encounter with the risen Christ through the Spirit.
Church members – $100 ($25 for each additional sibling)
Supply Fee (1/2 due w/ Sept. tuition, remainder due w/Jan. tuition)
Come join us for worship at 10:00 AM each Sunday!
At Mt. Horeb, we uphold five Core Values that define who we are. They are five verbs that underscore everything we do as a family of faith. They are…
Joyfully proclaim the Word of God
Dutifully study, teach and live the Word of God
Boldly share the Word of God
Humbly and enthusiastically respond to the Word of God
Gladly give our time, talent and treasures motivated by the Word of God

The Mt. Horeb Preschool serves the church family and surrounding community by offering a quality child development program for children ages two through four. The Mt. Horeb learning environment is rich, varied, warm, stimulating and safe for a young child’s healthy development. Teachers use The Creative Curriculum for Preschoolers, a developmentally appropriate, whole language, thematic approach to preschool education. Each classroom is arranged by interest areas, organized to foster growth, imagination, creativity and independence. Activities are planned through centers which include language, math, science and art activities.

Once a week, children enjoy a 30-minute music class, and our pastors leads chapel time every Wednesday morning. Other special activities include a Preschool Art Show, Holiday Music Program, Preschool Sunday at the church.
Two-year-olds attend either Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday.
Three-year-olds have the option of attending three days (M/T/W) or four days (M-Th).
Four-year-olds have the option of attending four days (M-Th) or five days (M-F).

Regular preschool hours are Monday-Thursday from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m., but those enrolled in the Early Bird program may arrive in the morning at 8 a.m. Three- and four-year-olds may bring a lunch and join the Lunch Bunch, staying at the preschool until 2 p.m.
For more information, or to register for preschool, please contact Peggy Miller at
